values.title: gz sdf converter fails due to socket issues

content.raw:
From: https://github.com/ros/rosdistro/pull/19696#issuecomment-449377288

Command
```
cd /tmp/binarydeb/ros-melodic-rotors-gazebo-2.2.3 && gz sdf -p /tmp/binarydeb/ros-melodic-rotors-gazebo-2.2.3/models/rotors_description/urdf/iris_base.urdf >> /tmp/binarydeb/ros-melodic-rotors-gazebo-2.2.3/models/iris/iris.sdf
```

fails with
```
09:43:54 Unsupported setsockopt level=0 optname=32
09:43:54 Error setting socket option (IP_MULTICAST_IF).
09:43:54 Unsupported setsockopt level=0 optname=32
09:43:54 Error setting socket option (IP_MULTICAST_IF).
09:43:54 Did you set the environment variable IGN_IP with a correct IP address? 
09:43:54   [172.30.1.33] seems an invalid local IP address.
09:43:54   Using 127.0.0.1 as hostname.
09:43:54 Unsupported setsockopt level=0 optname=32
09:43:54 Error setting socket option (IP_MULTICAST_IF).
09:43:54 terminate called after throwing an instance of 'std::out_of_range'
09:43:54   what():  vector::_M_range_check: __n (which is 0) >= this->size() (which is 0)
```

which seems to be a known issue in ignition when used in Linux for Windows subsystem, but the cause might be similar on ARM Linux Kernels (not being aple to set IP_MULTICAST_IF on that socket - because it seems to be the wrong socket, not local loopback). See also https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/issues/2351/gazebo-issues-on-windows-subsystem-for

But I guess that is something build-system related that doesn't have much to do with our code, or whats your take on this?

In any case, thanks much for your support and merry christmas ;-)

---
The socket issue is likely related to our builds being run inside of docker with limited permissions. There might be something to do to make ignition-transport more robust to that, but in this case it looks like it shouldn't even be opening a socket if it's just converting a urdf to sdf.
content.html:
From: https://github.com/ros/rosdistro/pull/19696#issuecomment-449377288

Command

cd /tmp/binarydeb/ros-melodic-rotors-gazebo-2.2.3 && gz sdf -p /tmp/binarydeb/ros-melodic-rotors-gazebo-2.2.3/models/rotors_description/urdf/iris_base.urdf >> /tmp/binarydeb/ros-melodic-rotors-gazebo-2.2.3/models/iris/iris.sdf

fails with

09:43:54 Unsupported setsockopt level=0 optname=32
09:43:54 Error setting socket option (IP_MULTICAST_IF).
09:43:54 Unsupported setsockopt level=0 optname=32
09:43:54 Error setting socket option (IP_MULTICAST_IF).
09:43:54 Did you set the environment variable IGN_IP with a correct IP address? 
09:43:54   [172.30.1.33] seems an invalid local IP address.
09:43:54   Using 127.0.0.1 as hostname.
09:43:54 Unsupported setsockopt level=0 optname=32
09:43:54 Error setting socket option (IP_MULTICAST_IF).
09:43:54 terminate called after throwing an instance of 'std::out_of_range'
09:43:54   what():  vector::_M_range_check: __n (which is 0) >= this->size() (which is 0)

which seems to be a known issue in ignition when used in Linux for Windows subsystem, but the cause might be similar on ARM Linux Kernels (not being aple to set IP_MULTICAST_IF on that socket - because it seems to be the wrong socket, not local loopback). See also https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/issues/2351/gazebo-issues-on-windows-subsystem-for

But I guess that is something build-system related that doesn't have much to do with our code, or whats your take on this?

In any case, thanks much for your support and merry christmas ;-)

The socket issue is likely related to our builds being run inside of docker with limited permissions. There might be something to do to make ignition-transport more robust to that, but in this case it looks like it shouldn't even be opening a socket if it's just converting a urdf to sdf.

values.title: Bionic debbuilds unstable: man files and static plugin not installed

content.raw:
* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=gazebo9-debbuilder&build=428)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo9-debbuilder/428/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo9-debbuilder/428/
* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=gazebo9-debbuilder&build=429)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo9-debbuilder/429/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo9-debbuilder/429/

~~~
dh_missing: usr/share/man/man1/gz.1.gz exists in debian/tmp but is not installed to anywhere
dh_missing: usr/share/man/man1/gzclient.1.gz exists in debian/tmp but is not installed to anywhere
dh_missing: usr/share/man/man1/gzserver.1.gz exists in debian/tmp but is not installed to anywhere
dh_missing: usr/share/man/man1/gazebo.1.gz exists in debian/tmp but is not installed to anywhere
dh_missing: usr/share/man/man1/gzprop.1.gz exists in debian/tmp but is not installed to anywhere
dh_missing: usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/gazebo-9/plugins/libTrackedVehiclePlugin.a exists in debian/tmp but is not installed to anywhere
~~~

why is there a static library for a plugin?
